description:
Refurbishment of existing students accommodation, including
Listed Georgian terrace, new accommodation blocks and open
courtyard, involving partial demolition at the rear and
adjacent modern block for hostel use, change of use to self-
contained flats for student/staff accommodation,
as shown on drawing numbers 3193 AL (0) PO2-A, PO3-A, PO4-A,
PO5-A, PO6-A, PO7-A, PO8-A, PO9-A, & P45A, 3193 AL (2) P43 &
P44, 3193 AL (2) 72GT-D, 73GT-D, 74GT-D, 75GT-D, 76GT-D,
77GT-B & 80GT-C.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Detailed specifications, drawings at a minimum of 1:20, and
    samples of all elements of all external elevations shall be
    submitted to, and be approved by the local planning
    authority in writing, prior to the relevant works commencing
    on site.

Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until full details of hard
    and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all unbuilt,
    open areas have been submitted to and approved by the local
    planning authority in writing, and be implemented
    thereafter.

Condition : 3 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to
    following planting season, with others of similar size and
    species, unless the local planning authority gives written
    consent to any variation.
    a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved
    landscape details, prior to the occupation for the permitted
    use of the development or any phase of the development,
    whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting
    which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the
    development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or
    diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably
    possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the

Condition : 4 - Noise levels at a point 1 metre external to sensitive
    equipment at any sensitive faï¿½ade to at least 10dB(A) below
    the LA90, expressed in dB (A).  Before the use commences all
    plant and machinery shall be sound attenuated and isolated
    from the structure to prevent the transmission of noise and
    or vibration to any other parts of the building and
    adjoining premises.
    facades shall be at least 5dB(A) less than the existing
    background measurement (LA90), expressed in dB (A) when all
    plant/equipment are in operation. Where it is anticipated
    that any plant/equipment will have a noise that has a
    distinguishable, discrete continuous note (whine, hiss,
    screech, hum) and/or if there are distinct impulses (bangs,
    clicks, clatters, thumps) special attention should be given
    to reducing the noise levels from that piece of plant/

Condition : 5 - Detailed specifications, drawings at a minimum of 1:20, and
    samples of all elements of the proposed basement area
    railings shall be submitted to, and be approved by the local
    planning authority in writing, prior to the relevant works
    commencing on site.

Condition : 6 - No development shall take place until details and plans of
    the alterations to the Brunswick Square elevations and
    entrance, have been submitted to, and approved in writing
    by, the Local Planning Authority, and the development shall
    not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any
    such approval given.

Condition : 7 - Notwithstanding the glazed entrance canopy on Lansdowne
    Terrace, as shown on the plans hereby approved, the
    structure shall not extend beyond the front building line as
    defined by the adjacent listed terrace.  Details of the
    proposed canopy, and samples of the materials to be used,
    shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local
    Planning Authority prior to commencement of this part of the
    development.

Condition : 8 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 9 - To enable the Council to ensure a high standard of external
    landscaping and visual amenity in the scheme in accordance
    with the requirements of policies EN15 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 10 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN15 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 11 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy
    RE2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan
    2000.

Condition : 12 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 13 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building, and the setting of the
    adjacent listed buildings in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN13, and EN38 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 15 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 16 - The details required pursuant to additional condition(s) 1,
    2, 5, 6 and 7 should be submitted together with 5 sets of
    drawings and any other supporting information.

Condition : 17 - For the avoidance of doubt Condition 02 requires a holistic
    will be required as well as a detailed rationale for soft
    landscaping and the treatment of boundary railings.
    approach to be taken in respect of all unbuilt and open
    areas of the site. The submission of an overall strategy for
    the entire block is necessary which includes a high quality
    design approach to both the internal courtyards and the
    external spaces. In respect of the elements fronting the
    public domain, particular reference needs to be made to the
    recessed entrance area on Landsdowne Terrace and the
    Grenville Street frontage. High quality surface treatment
